text: not seeing the 98 for style here. Its ok, especially next to some of the misses from GC, but definitely nothing special. A well balanced crisp ale, hoppier than usual for the style.

Tap at the brewery. Pours clear amber with a small, fizzy white head, short retention with spare lacing. Aroma is clean nutty and caramel malt and light earthy hops. Flavor is sweet Vienna malt, light earthy hops and bitterness with a sweet finish. Medium body and carbonation.
Clear amber with a fair white head. Light malty. Clean and smooth. Nothing too exciting but decent.
Lots of caramel, malt, crackers, wheat. Fairly sweet, full bodied, pretty smooth. Decent beer

Pretty good lacing for a lager, nice little white head bubbles off. Dark copper color. Nice aroma, this is lagered? Lots of complexity for the style. Taste is very good, a little bit of sourness at the end but overall well balanced and perfect for the style. Plenty of that malty goodness in it. Good body--not thin, not thick. Medium.
Poured at the AZ beer event at WOB in Tempe. Crisp lager, malty, toffee, wheat crackers. Smooth and somewhat refined.
A nice orange color. Not much aroma at all. This is sessionable, which is surprising considering the relatively high alcohol, at 7.2%. A tad bit of hops with some sweet malt, but smooth.
On draft at the brewpub. Pours a clear copper with a white head. Mild malty nose. Caramel notes. Smooth finish.
Sampled at the Tucson Beer Fest.  Clear darker gold.  This offers some rich malt and some that are pale.  Very light hops that might be noble.  Somr fruit is pretty nice.  Earth.  Just ok.

(on draught at Cruisers).  Pours clear dark amber with a thin white head.  Nice carbonation.  Aroma is sweet malt, rock candy and perfumey florals.  Taste is sweet with more perfume and light bitterness.  Full bodied with an oily texture.  Smooth finish.  The beer was a bit perfumey for me in aroma and taste, but its still an easy-to-drink beer and perfect for the setting.

Not my favorite style but good sampled at Cruisers 66 which the waitress told me was an extension of the brew pub next door that was closed due to a roof colapse after a heavy snow. This had a nice malty backbone with a nice hop balance. none of the musky smell you sometimes get.
On tap @ GCBC - Pours a clear amber color with a thin off white head.  Aroma is mostly herbal hops.  Flavor is lightly sweetened malt and herbal hops.  Medium body.  A nice easy drinking beer.
Pours a honey almost deep apple juice in color.  A good smooth taste with mild sweetness.  A very easy drinking beer.  Its only issue is its slight red aftertaste.
UPDATED: JAN 20, 2009 Tap at the brewpub. Med. Reddish Carmel in color with light white top. Aroma of light hops. Light body. Taste of wood, wheat and honey. Semi-smooth

tap at the brewpub - Pours light amber with a lingering white head.  It has a caramel malt aroma and a lightly toasted caramel malt flavor.  Light bodied, malty, and easy drinking, it’s very typical for the style.
